page.title: 11The Church Silver
page.content: The church is rich in altar vessels. Laurence Staunton, rector in 1587 gave a silver gilt chalice dated 1612. Robert Bertie gave a chalice,2 flagons 2 patons, an alms dish and a large spoon all in silver gilt. In 1685 he gave the brass chandelier hanging in the body of the church. In 1724 Lady Trollope gave a large silver dish weighing 68 oz.The Brass Eagle Lectern was the gift from Lady Charlotte Schreiber in 1866. The Church chest, containing records of parish history , one being of the year 1701, is thought to be German 17th century. It was lost to the church for many years but found in a builders yard,restored and donated by Arthur Sells in 1928. The fine church gates erected in 1679 at a cost of Â£18 were restored in 1953 at a cost of Â£160.
